intro: Campanula pusilla var. gautieri, commonly known as the Gautier's bellflower, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It features small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to violet, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. It is often found in alpine meadows and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and delicate species requiring specific growing conditions.
